title: Google\Cloud\Container\V1\NodePool
name: NodePool
description:
NodePool contains the name and configuration for a cluster's node pool.

Node pools are a set of nodes (i.e. VM's), with a common configuration and specification, under the control of the cluster master. They may have a set of Kubernetes labels applied to them, which may be used to reference them during pod scheduling. They may also be resized up or down, to accommodate the workload.

Generated from protobuf message google.container.v1.NodePool

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the node pool.

params.name: data.config
params.description: The node configuration of the pool.

params.name: data.initial_node_count
params.description: The initial node count for the pool. You must ensure that your Compute Engine resource quota is sufficient for this number of instances. You must also have available firewall and routes quota.

params.name: data.locations
params.description: The list of Google Compute Engine zones in which the NodePool's nodes should be located. If this value is unspecified during node pool creation, the Cluster.Locations value will be used, instead. Warning: changing node pool locations will result in nodes being added and/or removed.

params.name: data.network_config
params.description: Networking configuration for this NodePool. If specified, it overrides the cluster-level defaults.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.version
params.description: The version of the Kubernetes of this node.

params.name: data.instance_group_urls
params.description: [Output only] The resource URLs of the managed instance groups associated with this node pool. During the node pool blue-green upgrade operation, the URLs contain both blue and green resources.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output only] The status of the nodes in this pool instance.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: [Output only] Deprecated. Use conditions instead. Additional information about the current status of this node pool instance, if available.

params.name: data.autoscaling
params.description: Autoscaler configuration for this NodePool. Autoscaler is enabled only if a valid configuration is present.

params.name: data.management
params.description: NodeManagement configuration for this NodePool.

params.name: data.max_pods_constraint
params.description: The constraint on the maximum number of pods that can be run simultaneously on a node in the node pool.

params.name: data.conditions
params.description: Which conditions caused the current node pool state.

params.name: data.pod_ipv4_cidr_size
params.description: [Output only] The pod CIDR block size per node in this node pool.

params.name: data.upgrade_settings
params.description: Upgrade settings control disruption and speed of the upgrade.

params.name: data.update_info
params.description: Output only. [Output only] Update info contains relevant information during a node pool update.
